S129A Alpha-Synuclein Drosophila.Authors: Li Chen and Mel B Feany
S129A Alpha-Synuclein Drosophila.Title: Alpha-Synuclein Phosphorylation controls neurotoxicity and inclusion formation in a Drosophila model of Parkinson's disease
S129A Alpha-Synuclein Drosophila.Definition: This transgenic drosophila bears alpha-synuclein with a mutation at serine 129, the location where phosphorylation takes place.  This mutation was created with site-directed mutagenesis by replacing the serine codon with an alanine codon, which blocks phosphorylation.  These drosophila exhibit no symptoms of neurodegeneration.
